title: Electric potential - 1 cm slab is 2 cm from sheet

content.question: A thin, insulating sheet with a positive uniform charge density is near a thick, conducting slab that has zero net charge, as shown in the figure. Both the thin sheet and the thick slab are very large. The insulting sheet is <math alttext="2 centimeters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>cm</mi></math> from the conducting slab, and the slab is <math alttext="1 centimeter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>cm</mi></math> thick. Also shown are two labeled points: Point <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math>, which is <math alttext="1 centimeter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>cm</mi></math> above the slab, and Point <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math>, which is <math alttext="1 centimeter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>cm</mi></math> below the sheet. If the electric field at the surface of the thin sheet has a magnitude of <math alttext="100 newtons per coulomb" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>100</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>N</mtext><mo>/</mo><mtext>C</mtext></math>, what is the magnitude of the electric potential difference between points <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math> and <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="2 volts" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">V</mi></math>
<math alttext="3 volts" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">V</mi></math>
<math alttext="4 volts" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">V</mi></math>
<math alttext="5 volts" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>5</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">V</mi></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="2 volts" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">V</mi></math>

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
